title: Add required generated PNG assets and enforce PNG dimension validation during build verification

requirements.summary: Add the required generated PNG assets under frontend/public/generated with exact filenames and dimensions so Vite publishes them to dist/generated and they are served from /generated/ at runtime.
acceptanceCriteria: Each listed filename exists as a real file under `frontend/public/generated/` with the exact casing and spelling.
Each listed image has the exact pixel dimensions specified in its filename (e.g., `...dim_800x600...` is exactly 800×600 px).
After `vite build`, each listed file exists under `frontend/dist/generated/` with the exact same filename.
At runtime, requesting `/generated/<filename>` returns HTTP 200 for each listed filename.

requirements.summary: Enhance frontend/vite-build-verify.js to validate required PNG presence and pixel dimensions (parsed from dim_WIDTHxHEIGHT in filename) in both public/generated and dist/generated, failing with clear English errors.
acceptanceCriteria: Running `node frontend/vite-build-verify.js` fails if any required file is missing from `frontend/public/generated` or `frontend/dist/generated`.
Running `node frontend/vite-build-verify.js` fails if any required file exists but its actual pixel dimensions do not match the `dim_WIDTHxHEIGHT` part of its filename.
Failure output is in English and identifies (a) the filename and (b) expected vs actual dimensions.
Script continues to pass when all required files exist and all dimensions match.

file_operations.description: Update the verification script to: (1) define the authoritative required PNG list (the 13 filenames from REQ-7) and require exact case-sensitive matches; (2) verify each required file exists in both frontend/public/generated and frontend/dist/generated; (3) parse expected WIDTH×HEIGHT from each filename segment dim_WIDTHxHEIGHT; (4) read actual PNG pixel dimensions (without adding external dependencies) and compare against expected; (5) exit with code 1 and clear English error messages that include filename plus expected vs actual dimensions and whether the failure is in public/generated or dist/generated; (6) ensure all logs/errors are English-only (remove emoji-only status markers where practical) while keeping output readable.
